718042f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Hudson Street
718042f-a.text:
Canal Street (right), north side, from Hudson to Varick Streets, and
Watts Street (left), north side, east from Hudson. The Watts Stree
buildings will be demolished in the mid 1920's for the Holland
Tunnel Plana.
1908.
Brown Brothers.
NEeGG ~ 376S
718042f-a.folder: Canal Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720511f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720511f-a.text:
Hudson Street (right), east side, south from Canal Streets Also
shown is Canal Street (left), south side, east from Hudson Street, show-
ing at the corner (S.E.) Salmon's Pharmacy with the New York Central
Railroad tracks (Hudson Street, right) passing its door. Buildings
shown at this corner, were rased in approximately 1928 and on their
site was erected the 12-story Green Terminal Building. On Canal Street,
extending to Varick Street (where street car is visible) is now also the
exit of the Holland Tunnel.
1908.
Brown Brothers.
720511f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

718044f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Hudson Street
718044f-a.text:
(1)
461 to 481 Canal Street, north side, east of, adjoining, and at
the east corner of Hudson Street.
October 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same part of the block, looking northwest, after the de-
molition of the old buildings.
February 12, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
718044f-a.folder: Canal Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718044f-b.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Hudson Street
718044f-b.text:
(1)
461 to 481 Canal Street, north side, east of, adjoining, and at
the east corner of Hudson Street.
October 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same part of the block, looking northwest, after the de-
molition of the old buildings.
February 12, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
718044f-b.folder: Canal Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718046f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Hudson Street
718046f-a.text:
Canal Street, south side, west from Hudson (left), to Watts
(right) Streets, showing a row of old buildings occupying this block
front and which subseduently will be replaced by a 12 story loft
structure (prior to 1932). The structure bearing the Miller Tompkins
& Co. signs is to be reconstructed according to the N.Y. times of
October 20, 1937 and ocoupied by the firm of Magnus, Mabee & Reynard
Inc. of 257 Rearl Street, dealers in essential oils. It will have
translucent glass fronts on both its Desbrosses (No. 16) and Watts
(No. 119-21) Street sides. Note on the latter thoroughfare, the Ninth
Avenue "gl" running on Greenwich Street.
September 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
718046f-a.folder: Canal Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720504f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720504f-a.text:
Hudson Street, east side, at Canal Street. In the right foreground
is a sentry box used by the railroad flagman. at this boint the
railroad tracks turn off Canal Street and down Hudan.
December 20, 1932,
P. L. Sperr.
720504f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

720514f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720514f-a.text:
259 to 275 Hudson Street, west side, betveen Canal and Spring
Streets. Nos. 2G1-285, the three 3-story houses in the center of the
picture, are frame faced with brick; the first being a brick structure.
No. 271, the 5story tenement just north of the last frame house will be
demolished (1937).  1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 562.
720514f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

720505f.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720505f.text:
247-249, 251-253 Hudson Street, west side, north of Canal Street,
a rear view across the site of 22-26 Renwick Street, which were
demolished around 1930.
About 1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection,Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 577.
720505f.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

720510f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720510f-a.text:
253, 249, 245, 241 Hudson Street, west side, north of Canal Street
and opposite the western end of Broome Street. No. 243-245, ad-
joining the light colored house uext to the vacant lot, is a
solid brick building, but the other three houses are frame with
brick facings.
About 1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 56l.
720510f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

720521f-b.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720521f-b.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

720521f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720521f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

718048f-b.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Hudson Street
718048f-b.text:
(1)
495-501 Canal Street, north side, between Hudson and Renwick Streets.
as seen from across Watts Street. Also shown is Renwick Street,(clear-
ance) at the N.E. corner of Canal Street.
July 26, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a further view northward on Renwick Street, to and
including Spring Street.
July 26, 1935.
L. Sperr.
718048f-b.folder: Canal Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718048f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Hudson Street
718048f-a.text:
(1)
495-501 Canal Street, north side, between Hudson and Renwick Streets.
as seen from across Watts Street. Also shown is Renwick Street,(clear-
ance) at the N.E. corner of Canal Street.
July 26, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a further view northward on Renwick Street, to and

July 26, 1935.
L. Sperr.
718048f-a.folder: Canal Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720506f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720506f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, north of Canal Street. Also shown are Nos.
15-21 Renwick Street, (Across clearance), at and adjoining the N.W. corner
of Canal Street.
July 27. 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
720506f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

720520f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720520f-a.text:
HAudson Street, west side, north from Canal (left) to Vandam (center)
Streets, as seen from Canal (immediate foreground) Street. The large
structure of which only the lower floors appear is the Board of Trans-
portation Building and is at the N.E. corner of Hudson and Broome Streets.
To the right of same (not shown) is the entmance to the Holland Tunnel.
June 11, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
720520f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

720503f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720503f-a.text:
Hudson Street,east side and Canal Street looking northwards
and showing the "I" at the Greenwich Street.
Manhattan Highways Comm.  January 26th,1937
720503f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY

720507f-b.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720507f-b.text:
(1)
Hudson treet, west side llooking south to Canal
Street, from Dominick Street.
(2)
Hudson Street, west side. This Touthwest corner Rnd
Dominick 5treet, at end of Street.
P.L.Speer.
NO REPRODUCTION:  October 2, 1938.

718043f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Hudson Street
718043f-a.text:
Canal Street, north side, from Hudson to Varick Streets, inclusive,
looking at Varick Street across the cleared triangular block where
the Holland Plaza Building will rise. This is the block shown in
Brown Brothers' 1908 view.
February 25, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
718043f-a.folder: Canal Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718049f-a.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Hudson Street
718049f-a.text:
Canal Street, north side, west from Hudson (right) to
Renwick (left) Streets. The photographer is viewing northwest-
ward and icludes at the right an extensive view up Hudson Street.
Views 2 and 3 are of the same locale,tho the latter veers
eastward to show the westerly portion of the Holland Tunnel Plaza.
The entrance to same adjoins the Board of Transortation Building,
(Chevrolet sign). This structure occupies the entire easterly
frontage of Hudson Street from Broome to Dominick treets.
View 1: June 3, 1933
Views 2-3 July 26, 1935
P . L. Sperr
718049f-a.folder: Canal Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718049f-c.title: Manhattan: Canal Street - Hudson Street
718049f-c.text:

720501f-b.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Canal Street
720501f-b.text:
(1)
219 to 259 Hudson Street, west side, at, adjoining, and north of
Canal Street, N. W. corner. No. 241, the white house adjoining
the vacant lot on the north, is a brick-faced frame, as are the
three-story building at No.249 and the 4-story building adjoining
it on the north, No. 253.
September 27, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same,and north to Spring Street, nearly six years later. A
filling station has, since 1931, replaced Nos. 219,221,223 at
the corner of Canal Street, Nos. 261, 263, 265, not shown in the
first picture, are also brick-faced frame houses.
June 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A detail of No. 1, showing the buildings that are rased in No. 2.
June 30, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
720501f-b.folder: Hudson Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY
